chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J. Galioto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with female minors without advanced agent approval and without supervision.  

Absolute sobriety. 

NO computer/internet without agent approval.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Register as sex offender.  Complete any assessment, evaluations, treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

No contact with victim(s): Females under the age of 18 years of age.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No computer use.  If defendant needs computer use for work, he must get permission from workplace.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 11:10 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF279 & 14CF487**
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears with Attorney Amanda Ley. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State files Amended Information in 14CF279. Ct.1- Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime amended to Ct.1- Child Enticement 948.07(1)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF279- Ct.1- Child Enticement>>GUILTY
           14CF487- Ct.1- Bail Jumping- Felony>>GUILTY 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty on Ct.1 in 14CF487 and finding is withheld on Ct.1 in 14CF279. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF279- DEOJ for 3 years on Ct.1- Child Enticement. CONDITIONS: Comply with conditions of bond, successfully complete probation in 14CF487, successfully complete terms and conditions of probation. If defendant successfully completes DEOJ, count will be dismissed. Defendant may petition for expungement at age 25 and successful completion of probation. 
                             14CF487- SWH 3 years probation on Ct.1- Bail Jumping- Felony. CONDITIONS: Participate in any assessment, counseling and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent, no contact with NMD, complete a psych eval, GFE to obtain/maintain full time work, schooling or a combination of both and if not; complete 5 hours CS per week and provide 2 verifiable job contacts to agent, CC & DNA surcharge.
COURT adopts and signs DEOJ agreement in 14CF279.
Attorney Ley requests bond for 14CF279 be modified to a signature bond. 
COURT GRANTS request. COURT ORDERS bond to be returned to poster.  
Modified Bond- $1,500.00 signature bond. CONDITIONS to remain the same as original bond. 
Review Hearing- March 1st, 2018 at 1:10 p.m.
